newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks surge three percent to record close.
newsitem.headline: French stocks surge three percent to record close.

text.p: French stocks surged three percent on Wednesday to an all-time closing high, powered by gains on Wall Street, a rebound in the dollar and higher bond prices.
The bourse's blue-chip CAC-40 index closed up 82.68 points, or 2.97 percent, at 2,867.44, and the CAC-40 June futures contract rose 68 points to 2,844.
The CAC index's previous closing record of 2,808.52 points was set on June 13.
The market's rise was helped by a rally in banking stocks after Compagnie Bancaire proposed to buy out minority holders in finance firms Cardif and Locabail.
Volume was heavy, with a hefty 14.66 billion francs changing hands.
Cie Bancaire closed up 6.83 percent at 735 francs. Several brokers raised earnings estimates for the banking group on the view that the buyouts would help results.
Cie Financiere Paribas, which controls Cie Bancaire, gained 4.16 percent to 403.20 francs. Brokers said they believe Paribas has more restructuring moves in the pipeline.
Other stocks driven higher included Societe Generale, up 4.23 percent at 665 francs, and BNP, up 3.78 percent at 244.20.
